urls.title: | Environment Agency Board Member
urls.description: Department for Environment, Food & Rural Affairs Environment, Food & Rural Affairs D irector of Floods and Water, Defra ‚Ä¢ Departmental Official Chair, Environment Agency ‚Ä¢ Representative of Organisation Chair, Highways England ‚Ä¢ Independent Member ‚Ä¢ sets the strategy, drives performance and holds the organisation to account; ‚Ä¢ provides stewardship for public funds and environmental outcomes. The Board is made up of a Chair, Chief Executive and up to 14 other members. The Board has a collegiate style. It

tweets.text:
We‚Äôre looking for new leaders in flood and coastal erosion risk management and in land management to join the @EnvAgency Board.

We can now see it‚Äôs not the @EnvAgency being scared of an orphaned site , they‚Äôre scared of footing the bill to restore it . It‚Äôs a case of The EA with no money , red with no interest and us in the middle with no quality of life . @StinkStopthe

tweets.text: 3/4 The new #Flood Action Plan sees communities, local authorities and government working together to reduce the risk from flooding and coastal erosion across England, increasing resilience and helping to tackle the climate emergency.

urls.title: The RNLI reflects on the tragic plight of the minke whale
urls.description: After yesterday's tragic ending to the story of the minke whale trapped in the Thames, the RNLI reflect on the whale's story.

tweets.text:
"Every so often a story such as this is driven by the emotions as much as the facts." Thank you to all the rescue teams who worked tirelessly to help the whale and to @rnli_teddington for this reflective piece. @RNLI @BDMLR @EnvAgency @metpoliceuk
https://t.co/9Du3EeJEUr

urls.title: B-lines | Shropshire Wildlife Trust
urls.description: The B-Lines are a series of ‚Äòinsect pathways‚Äô running through our countryside and towns, along which we are restoring and creating a series of wildflower-rich habitat stepping stones. They link existing wildlife areas together, creating a network, like a railway, that will weave across the British landscape.

urls.title: United Utilities - <Work completed to protect homes from flooding>
urls.description: External flooding of homes in Rock View, Sefton should soon be a thing of the past, thanks to work that‚Äôs been completed by United Utilities.

tweets.text: A major sewer upgrade project is nearing completion in #MySefton, which should prevent the risk of external flooding to a number of homes. We‚Äôll continue to work with @seftoncouncil and @ENVAgencyNW to explore more solutions to reduce the risk of flooding. https://t.co/8sQ69XFRpQ https://t.co/7Qap8s8TO8
